metadata.name: Industrial Devolution #70
metadata.description:
As the abandoned sewage planet Xnor lay seemingly dormant, aeons crept by. Erosion and oxidation recombined in plumbing, slowly causing the pipes to evolve sentience and grow to the horizon in a blooming chaos of rust, steel and concrete.

Industrial Devolution is the first long-form generative project using my rayhatching algorithm. It combines a raymarcher for SDFs with a surface orientation based flow field renderer in order to draw arbitrary 3D scenes as line art, with an organic, hatched drawing style. The SDF formulas were generatively designed and parametrized to form ancient landscapes of corroded industrial pipes and immense, ageless blocks of concrete.

The entire code of Industrial Devolution is 3930 characters, using no external libraries.

When done rendering, the output can be right-click saved as an SVG file and plotted using a plotter such as an Axidraw. The lines in the SVG are in random order, so it is recommended to use a path reordering/optimizing tool such as axicli or vpype before plotting. This will greatly reduce the plotting time. The output SVG is intended to be plotted at A3 (297x420mm) using a 0.4mm black pen (but feel free to experiment). You can change this by adding these options to the URL:

  &lw=.4 the linewidth in millimetres
  &d=.8 the line density (multiplier to the line width, density 0.6 recommended for plotter output)
  &h=420 how high the page is, in millimetres (width is always height * 0.707)
  &bg=1 set to 0 to remove background rectangle (bg=0 recommended for plotter output)

Industrial Devolution was released during a live minting event at Bright Moments Gallery, Venice Beach in collaboration with Bright Moments, fx(hash) and Tender.

metadata.name: Millefoglie #222
metadata.description:
"A mille-feuille (French pronunciation: ​[mil fœj], "thousand-sheets"), also known by the names Napoleon, vanilla slice, and custard slice, is a dessert made of puff pastry layered with pastry cream. Its modern form was influenced by improvements made by Marie-Antoine Carême.

Traditionally, a mille-feuille is made up of three layers of puff pastry (pâte feuilletée), alternating with two layers of pastry cream (crème pâtissière). The top pastry layer is finished in various ways: sometimes it is topped with whipped cream, or it may be dusted with icing sugar, cocoa, pastry crumbs, or sliced almonds. It may also be glazed with icing or fondant alone, or in alternating white (icing) and brown (chocolate) or other colored icing stripes, and combed to create a marbled effect." — Wikipedia

Prints available upon request: prints@stefancontiero.com
Best enjoyed on browsers supporting Display-P3 color gamut.

License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

@stefan_contiero

metadata.name: Hyper Drive: B-Side #18
metadata.description:
Hyper Drive is based on the mathematics of recursion. Scale symmetry is used to create patterns that repeat at ever-smaller intervals, creating the illusion of infinite depth and complexity.

The rule for the recursive loop is incredibly simple. A box is drawn, then a snapshot of the full canvas is resized to cover the boundary. As this process is repeated, small variations in position create endless fractals.

This project is an experimental cross-chain collection, with a fully-generative A-side published via Art Blocks on Ethereum and an AI-based image composition B-side published via fxhash on Tezos. The artwork symbolizes the great divides we must cross, the connections we make along the way, and the disconnections we feel. We move through the world as the world moves through us.

metadata.name: PixlFlippr #495
metadata.description:
PixlFlippr is an offshoot of my "Simple Harmonic Motion" series, inspired by the complexity of life emerging through the interaction of simple 'dumb' behaviors, with intricate details emerging on multiple scales. PixlFlippr operates on a pixel level (in the form of a GLSL frag shader).

Every pixel oscillates at a single fixed frequency, slightly out-of-sync with its neighbors. There is no explicit pixel-neighborhood communication (as there would be in eg Cellular Automata), and every pixel acts autonomously, oblivious to its surroundings. Yet collectively, the entire system exhibits constantly evolving complex high level behavior on many scales, ranging from patterns & behaviors spanning a few pixels, all the way up to the level of the entire image. These are further amplified through the emergent pixel aliasing artefacts & moiré patterns. 

Also, it's trippy af. 

PS All generative mints are a seamless loop with a loop duration ranging from a few minutes to over an hour. So stick around & watch it mutate!

metadata.name: Mosaic #760
metadata.description:
---
Notes:
- Click to pause/unpause
- The aspect ratio is fixed 1:1 because of the way the grid and movements are generated to make sure they're the same on all screens. 
---
Description:
An 80X80 grid of tiles are scrambled, shuffled, shifted, streamed, transported,
conveyed, moved, deposited. 

There are 15 initial tile states and 5 color palettes. A set of 12 unique motion patterns
are generated for each piece. 
---
Acknowledgements:
This piece is inspired by Kim Asendorf, whose pixel-level algorithms I'm
transfixed by, and Ksawery Komputery, whose algorithmic tile-works I'm crazy
about. 
---
Made by Sam Tsao (@sam___tsao) with P5.js 
December 2021, Germany

metadata.name: Making Mole Hills #94
metadata.description:
Making Mole Hills is a space filling algorithm, similar to a flood fill. Rules have been structured to create mountain shapes, rather than evenly filling the canvas. Seed pixels begin to propagate themselves outwards, based initial conditions. After the space has been filled, the algorithm will pause, and then new mountain building will commence.

Features:
- Pixel Detail: Low 60%, Medium 30%, or High 10%. Controls the resolution of the grid
- Color Mode: Multi-hued 85%, Duotone 10%, or Black and White 5%. Multihued palettes change slowly over time. If you aren't happy at first, wait a few minutes and it will evolve
- Avalanche: Can be either None 80%, Falling 15%, or Rising 5%. This controls color animation separate from the pixel expansion
- Peak Type: Crowded 50%, Clustered 25%, Coupled 17.5%, or Lonely 7.5%. # of seed pixels to start with
- Organization: Tumbled 50%, Chaotic 40%, Ordered 10%. Controls the amount of randomness as the piece expands
- Color Frequency: Variegated 50%, Soft 40%, Hyper 10%

metadata.name: Encircling #45
metadata.description:
Overlapping Vision.

There are no rarity attributes assigned to this artwork, its value is intended to be determined by viewer aesthetic alone.

This artwork was created using p5js and utilizes the p5.pattern library created by Taichi Sayama.

metadata.name: MOMENT #272
metadata.description:
An endless row of them making up each life. Some poignant, some inspiring, some grievous, some affirming - but most of them a tad boring, a bit generic, almost forgettable like bland fabric. How can a life constructed from such mundanity count for anything? Maybe thanks to the last one, the one that stitches them all together, like a punchline to an absurdist joke.

Generative art written in JavaScript + Canvas with a little bit of help from p5.js.

metadata.name: fxBLOCK #67
metadata.description:
fxBLOCK is a collection of speculative architectures. 
Each minted BLOCK is constructed using a set of polyvalent parts in various deterministic tectonic configurations, lights, and moods. 

fx(hash) genesis Generative Token by @grasser_alex 2021

metadata.name: Blobby #489
metadata.description:
A sphere that has been contorted (or not) in various fashions! 

The spike level indicates how dense the protrusions are and the displacement level indicates how far these protrusions go. If any of those are 0, you'll get a flat sphere.

metadata.name: RGB Elementary Cellular Automaton #431
metadata.description:
Stephen Wolfram's Elementary Cellular Automaton where 3 different rules are drawn in the Red, Green and Blue color components of the image.

Rules are selected randomly among a pre-selection of 53 rules from which nice behaviors emerge.

Tokens can have a cell size in the [1; 20] range.

```Everything you do, it's been done done done before
Everything you say, yeah you said that yesterday```

change colos on click

metadata.name: lakeside village #68
metadata.description:
a hilly landscape with a village on the shore of a lake made in ⌨️ p5.js
inspired by the paintings of Alessandro Ciulli and by the harmonic beauty of Tuscan countryside

in this work I use the fusion of code and figurative art implementing shaded colors, every iteration presents a number of colors, sizes and shapes variables such as to make the possible landscapes tend to infinity, each of which is somehow connected to a physical or metaphysical place of the personal experience of the beholder, and the use of the machine and the code as contemporary brushes becomes an instrument of discovery and imaginative exploration of territories of the body and the soul

unique generative properties:
colors🎨, number, positions and size of clouds ☁️, hills ✨, houses 🏘️ and trees 🌲   
color🎨 position and size of the sun ☀️ 
colors🎨 of the sky and the lake ☱

feature -> tone of the image: colors or monochrome
's' -> png 1920x1920px
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Hypergiraffe #55
metadata.description: 3965 bytes of Javascript produce a generative doodling in resolution independent SVG format. Be sure to check the features for your each piece's custom title! By Piter Pasma (piterpasma.nl)

attributes.name: title
